result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Submit a DNA sample by 4/29/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

No firearms and dangerous weapons.
No contact with E.M.J.  Probation agent may change to a no violent contact order if the victim requests it and agent deems appropriate.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No illegal drugs or alcohol.
No prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
Complete an anger management class.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
AODA assessment and compliance with treatment.  Random UA's.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent. Straight time.  Credit for 48 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Timothy Wenzel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the state, Court ordered count 3 dismissed but read-in for the purpose of sentencing.
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 90 DAYS CONCURRENT, straight time, in the House of Correction, credit of 48 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 5 MONTHS CONCURRENT, straight time, in the House of Correction, credit of 48 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 4/29/22.
- AODA assessment and compliance with treatment
- Mental health assessment and comply with all recommended treatment.
- Complete an anger management class.
- No firearms and dangerous weapons.
- No contact with EMJ.  Probation agent may change to a no violent contact order if the victim requests it and agent deems it appropriate.
- Random UA's.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.
- No prescription drugs without a valid prescription
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 4/29/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel not in court, in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Mogren requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EMJ

Defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Joel Timothy Wenzel in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joel Timothy Wenzel appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
